text: Ofelia Garcia is a Cuban-born artist, curator, art educator and administrator. She was a faculty member and Director of the Studio Art Department at Boston College Art Department, served as General Critic at Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts, served as director of The Print Center in Philadelphia, and was president of the Atlanta College of Art, and president of Rosemont College from 1991–1995. She was Professor of Art at William Paterson University where she also served as Dean of the College of the Arts and Communications. Garcia is currently a Professor Emerita in the Urban Education and of Latin American, Iberian, and Latino Cultures (LAILAC) programs at the Graduate Center of the City University of New York. ==Exhibitions== Garcia curated the exhibition Printed by women: A national exhibition of photographs and prints at the Port of History Museum, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and co-authored, with Judith K. Brodsky the exhibition catalog. ==Honors== In 2011 Garcia was honored with the Women's Caucus for Art Lifetime Achievement Award. ==References== Category:American artists Category:American people of Cuban descent Category:American women artists Category:Women educators Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people Category:American art curators
